content.detailedDescription: On july 4th 2012 around 10:15-10:30, the time of nearby firework displays, several of my family members saw a bright red-orange light in the sky slowly ascend over the mountain range and and then stop in one spot hovering for a few minutes. shortly after another object of the same description followed the exact same flight path, as the first one ascended in a shifty manner the second one stopped taking the place of the first one and hovered there until a 3rd one took the same flight path and did the same thing. a total of 4 objects took the same single file flight path, hovering for moments until they shiftily ascended and eventually disappeared one by one.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 4 bright red-orange lights taking same flight path one after the other.

content.detailedDescription: My family and i were waiting to watch the fireworks show at the speedway when we first noticed the object to the nw of us. it travelled steadily south and made no noticeable noise. there were no visible marker lights and it appeared to be a thimble shaped object emitting an afterburner-like flame straight down from the bottom. it travelled south and slowly disappeared. my young daught was the first to mention that it was a ufo. we were all awestruck and could not explain what it was. i grew up near an airbase and have seen all types of military aircraft. nothing like this.
content.summary: Thimble shaped silouette with flame discharge similar to after burner on jet. discharge went down from bottom of object.

content.detailedDescription: I was getting some things out of my car around 11pm on 7/5/2012 in west hartford ct and i happened to look up to the north west in the area of the handle if ursa major and saw a bright orange/red star like object. i first thought to myself that it was mars, but realized mars is not in that part of the sky.  it then started moving towards the nortb for a duration of about 10 seconds and then just faded away.  i thought that being around the 4th of july that maybe it could have been some sort of firework, however this object was high up in the atmosphere and was definitely not a firework.
content.summary: Glowing orange/red object moved across sky

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting on our swing watching a few of the neighbors fireworks on the 4th of july. we heard someone we know beep as they drove by the front and glanced over our shoulder and noticed what looked like a glowing red-orange balloon in the sky that was moving steadily to the northeast and getting smaller (maybe from moving away) until it disappeared. this lasted for several minutes. we thought maybe it was a firework but had never seen one float along like that for so long. we tried taking a picture, but it turned out blurry (it was still on fireworks setting) so we took a short video of it.
content.summary: Looked like a glowing balloon that was getting smaller (maybe from moving away) and then disappeared

content.detailedDescription: I am a 26 year old man and my wife is 20 and we have never sufferd from sleep walking or anything like that... i wake up mostly every night to pee but for some reason i am scared of what i feel in my gut that is aliens and this is why,,, i am afraid of being abducted with my wife and now 1 year old daughter... something realy strange has happend to me and my wife,,, it was 2010 but i dont remember when... me and my wife have a small bed and we always sleep on the same side we never do things like tonight we will sleep where we lay our feet and tomorrow the other way around... but one morning we both woke up on the wrong side of the bed... the 2 of us.... we woke up with our heads where we lay our feet... we imediatly knew that it was something realy strange and we looked at each other like what just happend its imposible because our bed is to small we would of both had to have gotten up and leyd back down on the wrong side of the bed... i am writing this to mufon because this year i saw a show on discovery that said most of the people that have been abducted dont even know and i strongly feel that me and my wife are one of those people... this year 2012 i woke up one morning and my butt realy hurt alot,,, it felt like if i had just gotten an injection and it hurt for 2 days... this has never happend to me in my entire life befor or to my wife... then maybe like 3 weeks later my wife woke up and told me that her arm realy hurt and that she felt as if she had gotten an injection and i imediatly told her about the show i saw on discovery and that most of the people dont know that they have gotten abducted... i reminded her about that strange morning in 2010... this is why i am writing my story,,, i would like to know if this happens to other people... i am scared at night of being abducted with my family.... please mufon call me to give me info and so that i can talk to one of youre specialist,,, i am sick i hardly cant sleep and i am feeling the effects of not sleeping... please call me 503 77508531
content.summary: I feel strongly that my wife and i have been abducted

content.detailedDescription:
On the 4th of july, we went to see the fireworks at fair park in dallas. we parked in a church parking lot at the corner of gurley ave and carroll. many other people were parked here as well. i noticed two red/orange slow-moving orbs, or what i first thought were fireworks. i was thinking, "why aren't they racing upward to explode like they usually do?" i asked my cousin, "what are those!?" we thought they looked like chinese lanterns on fire. then we noticed they weren't going up, they were moving sideways, and i thought it was weird that they seemed to be "caught in the wind" and moving away from where the fireworks would be. i'm not good with direction, but we were facing fair park from the parking lot, and these orbs were moving past us, in the direction behind us.
they were not moving quickly. they never seemed to stop moving but taking their very sweet time, maybe going about 20-30 mph. everyone was staring at them, trying to figure out what they were. they were reminiscent of tail lights on a car, but far apart from each other. they were also hovering rather low, which is the other reason i discerned they weren't fireworks. low, slow moving, and non-exploding. and then i got impatient waiting for the fireworks and forgot all about them.
until the next day. my brother in law arrived at my house to pick up his kids and he sat down and said, "i saw something last night." the kids were around so he was hesitant to go into detail at first but i instantly knew what he was talking about. i told him to tell me what he saw, and he described exactly what my cousin and i saw, and he lives at least 30 minutes away from where we saw them. and it was at the exact same time.
content.summary: Red/orange glowing, hovering orbs on 4th of july pre-fireworks

content.detailedDescription:
July 5, 2012 ��� observation started at 9:35 pm and the night sky is so clear i can see the milky way unaided to the east at a 45-degree angle. observation location is near the corner of fm 2407 and garden drive in atascosa county, texas.
 
at 9:58 pm i was scanning the southern sky (where most of the nightly activity take place) when i noticed a familure star like object enter earth's atmosphere from the north up at a 75 degree angle and to my east. 

like i have witnessed before, when i first noticed the star light object, it is traveling in a southbound flight path from the north and when it enters the earth atmosphere, it turns into a very bright and expanding light. the star like object looks like it makes an impact explosion into our atmosphere and its size and brightness enlarges to the size of my close fist at arm's length. as before, there is no sound during this event. in addition, this star like object enters right over the southern san antonio to laredo commercial airliner���s corridor. it is masking their earth's entry into known faa's flight paths, which is a very clever way to hide their descent.

after the object enters our atmosphere, it returns to the size of a star and continues its southbound flight path into the distant horizon and out of my sight.  

i do not think it is a common satellite for the impact should have destroyed it.  

the full moon rises from the east and i end this night's observation.
content.summary: Object using faa flight path

content.detailedDescription: Iwas in the front passenger seat as my husband was driving to work.  i was riding along so i could have the car. we were travelling south on shephardsville road and eventually turned left (east) on poplar level rd. my daughter had said something the night before about the moon being almost full so i glanced up at it.  my eye caught a very small white object near the moon.  visually it was about 1 inch to the left of the lower /mid left side of the moon. visually,it was about the size of the head of a plastic ball topped straight pin (used for sewing). it was descending to the left in a slow arc and had reached a point where i could still see this small object between the power lines, this is the point where we turned east (away from the object) and lost sight of it.  by the time we parked it was out of our sight.  the object had such a light color and even tho the sky was clear it had that early morning light blue/white hew to it.  the object was just white enough that you could see it.  it was too far to make out any discerable features.  lapsed time 2 min at best.  the arc didnot seem to be a true arc as the path varied/wavered a little.  no sound (way too far away for any sound to be heard if there was any). no contrails. no lights that i could see (again really to far away to discern).
content.summary: Looking at morning moon saw small white object up at the moon.It travelled down towards earth.Not a straightline trajectory, sort of an arc trajectory.

content.detailedDescription: I will update soon look at videos
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.shape: Blimp,   Boomerang,   Cigar,   Circle,   Disc,   Fireball,   Flash,   Oval,   Square,   Rectagular,   Star-like,   Triangle
content.summary: Blinking lights in mountains that eject other lights.. flying saucers.. lights in my home

content.detailedDescription:
I was jogging around 9pm on the 4th of july close by country gables and 59th ave at the ymca, i was jogging around the parking lot, when i looked up and saw an orange type fire orb  in the sky flying very slowly i assumed it was some new firework but of course that sounds dumb anyways after about 10 min it was headed towards  my rea  not exactly but it was coming in my direction and i could see it clearly i ran to  the left of the ymca and preceeded to run back hom i turned around and could still see it clearly but it started to sort  of fizzle out it's fire slowly stopped glowing and just went away.
i still have no idea what it was.
content.summary: Saw an orange fire orb slowly moving in the sky at 59th and country gables

content.detailedDescription: Boyfriend and i were sitting on roof of parents house watching neighbors firework show about 11pm on the 4th. i had the binoculars and looked behind us to see if anyone else had fireworks going off. i saw the first red orange orb and didn't really compute in my head that it was rather large. about a minute later i looked again and saw the second one going same speed and direction. they were flying north. i nudged my boyfriend and we watched the 2nd one until it went behind the lone tree in the field across the road from us. we waited for it to come out from the other side of the tree and it never did. when i looked at it w/the binoculars it looked transparent with the middle being a bright red light and fading out to outline the shape of it. i would compare it to a chinese lantern but very large and silent. too fast for a hotair balloon but about the same size i'd say.
content.summary: Chinese lantern lookin 2 bout 3 min apart same speed & direction. red

content.detailedDescription:
Its been happening for several months almost daily at my home in craftsbury common vermont.
many different things have happened. there are several orange/red lights glowing and flickering in the field and mountains behind my home. they
get really bright then sometimes seperate into 2 and one takes off or dims out. they also begin as one small orage light and turn into 3-4 they are fast and move from the mountain tops to the field in front of my house. they also appear to go into or near a farm on the mountain. this farm has a lot of activity from different colored lights/objects..

they come close to the house when im asleep or about to be and shine lights inside. these lights glow from celing to floor and sometimes random blue or red lights similar to a laser flash on the wall. they always seem to know where i am despite being sneaky and in complete darkness. there are also lights that illuminate the backyard and roof to chicken barn, despite a large canopy of trees. these lights come to the corner of the windows and glow. they glow from onr room to another as there are several hollow knots in the wood. these lights appear to be like flashdrones i researched online. they illuminate in the thick leafy trees and undergroth. today i saw a path through thr row of trees and vegetation that appeared to be blown out on all sides from center flattening and killing all the plants which were totally healthy yesterday. 

there are several different flying objects from what sound and appear to be a helacopter yet when on video they shoot all over the screen while flickering and changing color. in one video there were 2 small glowing blue lights in the sky when one dimmed out and left what appear to be smoke trails that go all over on the screen in the video.

there have been what sound like military jets chasing after a flying object. 

one night when my house began to light up at 1am i called a friend to check
it out,and as he circled around on the loop rd he saw someone squatted by the boat in the driveway. i heard him yell and ran to the window in time to see him chase and illuminated object/person with his car until reaching the edge of field, while then jumping out and beginning a foot chase. eventually the person got away and when my friend came back i could still see the person glowing/illuminating a couple acres away at the end of the field. i then began to ask what? who? how? when we herd a click and the backyard that had been light up for hours suddenly went pitch black. then a massive round saucer with red blinking lights appeared overhead and continued on its way. 

i have also herd footsteps all throught the night causing branches to break and snap. when this happens i usually hear coyotes howl and loons beinning to sound.    twice ive herd a loud growl unlike anything ive ever herd before.

its as though im completely surrounded. i can totally feel myself being watched!!  erie!!
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering
content.shape: Blimp,   Boomerang,   Bullet,   Missile,   Cigar,   Circle,   Fireball,   Flash,   Square,   Rectagular,   Star-like,   Triangle
content.summary: Several hovering objects, orange/red flickerin lights on mountain, flash drones, illumination, growing, planes flying etc...

content.detailedDescription: I had just gotten out of work and was at the nearest gas station with a coworker. at the same time, we noticed a yellow-orange light that twinkled like mars sometimes does. we were both immediately intrigued and were certain it wasn't a planet. there were no clouds in the sky and it was stationary at first, but difficult to judge its distance, but it appeared to be far overhead. the twinkle-effect changed to a slow blink remained still in the sky, at roughly 70 degrees from the horizon to our west. after about 25 seconds, it accelerated eastward and flew directly over us. it was the size and luminance of a bright star visible in a city. it travelled eastward, accelerating twice in bursts. the acceleration pattern reminded me of shifting a car into a higher gear, but between shifts the speed was constant. it continued blinking at roughly 35bpm for the entire travel time. at about 85 degrees above the eastern horizon, after it had passed over our heads, it arced roughly 5 degrees southward toward i-96e. during it's acceleration process, the object "up-shifts" from stationary to what would roughly be 800-1000mph if it were flying in the upper atmosphere where it appeared to be. when it reached about 60 degrees above the eastern horizon it appeared to either slow to a stop or change trajectory to match our path of eyesight. my coworker and i watched it return to a flicker or twinkle pattern, grow slightly dimmer, and then disappear (as if towards orbit and out of sight). as soon as it disappeared, we both said "there it goes." i have no idea what it was.
content.summary: Yellow/orange light hovers then accelerates along a path, blinks at random intervals.

content.detailedDescription: ,1 ahead 2 in back making a triangle... than 5 to 6 one behind the other heading after the first 3 towards soundless lightning.
content.summary: Amazing 3 in pyrimad form 5 loose towards lightning..

content.detailedDescription: Outside of my apartment my husband and i were standing talking to our neighbor. i happened to look up at the sky, which i often do, and noticed this bright ball. it startled me because for a brief moment i was going to comment on how odd it was to see venus in the sky at this time of night during this time of year. i immediately realized this wasn't a planet or start. it was moving. it was moving in the direction towards the ohio river, which is roughly north east. it moved it a straight line, had no tail or anything that could make it a potential shoot star. as it moved it hovered up a little bit than back down and was dimming as it moved.It got brighter again and then dimmed and disappeared. this only lasted a minute tops. i tried to rationalize it as best i could but shortly after and right before the sighting, some airplanes had flown over head. i compare the two and knew for a fact that this ball of light could not have been a plane, because i never lost sight of any of the planes that flew over head after the sighting and of course they didn't dim the way this ball did nor did the ball have the flashing lights like the planes. i can't say i was surprised or frightened by this, this isn't my first sighting of a ufo.
content.summary: Bright ball moving

content.detailedDescription: From my kitchen window i could see in the western sky a red blinking light that appeared to be rising slowly. the lights seemed to be blinking slowly. at first i thought it was fireworks rising from the ground. i was very curious so i went out on my deck.  now the object was moving in a straight line as an airplane or helicopter would do. the object seemed to be flying at an altitude that a helicopter or small plane would fly. i heard no sound as the object headed southeastward.  after about a minute or two of watching it all the lights suddenly went out.  because there was still some light in the sky from the recent sunset,  i was able to see what appeared to be  a diamond or square shaped black object moving on a straight path.  i followed it until i could no longer see it.  i did not see any lights come back on & i never heard a sound.
content.summary: Red blinking object moving slowly up & then on a straight path.  suddenly all lights went off & black object continued.

content.detailedDescription: While me and girlfriend waited for fireworks show in meridian from our street we observed from the north below high clouds comes a fiery orange round light that randomly grew/diminished in intensity moving at a steady pace, maybe that of a helicopter and generally around the same height they fly if they are local. as it flew directly overhead noticed no sound at all from object. object was not "floating" as a balloon, not being "carried by wind" but on a direct heading south. as the object headed away the light either diminished in intensity or was no longer visible as much from the rear of the body of the craft an we observed a dark grey or black body to the craft. the shape was hard to pin down as the edges were not smooth like a disc or egg. it was kind of squarish in shape but with protrusions round about. we watched it continually from start to finish maybe 4-6 minutes until it decreased in size in the far away dusk sky.
content.summary: Ufo fly over while waiting for fireworks show

content.detailedDescription: On july 5th, i observed a large dome shaped craft over the nashville downtown area. there were orange lights around the mid section of the craft. although i was driving down the interstate, i could tell the object was hovering in place. it appeared to be emitting a purple and green mist or dust of some kind.  it was huge. i know i'm not the only person who witnessed it. it looked unlike any aircraft i have ever seen. i heard no noise since i was in my car. i couldn't keep the object in view because i was traveling too fast.
content.summary: Large dome shaped objuct over downtown area

content.detailedDescription: Sitting in the hot tub, saw the object hit the atmosphere glowing brightly. it traveled from east to west. stopped north about light house field. it hovered at a high altitude and stayed stationary. three engines were clearly viewable. planes started to come in from the west and the object exited the atmosphere in a straight vertical lift till the engines were no longer visible. the object was in the sky for approximately 5 minutes. no sound was heard and no alcohol was involved. i cannot believe that there weren't other people who saw it as well.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Entered atmosphere east to west glowing like an orange cigar.

content.detailedDescription: For fourth of july, we went to fair park in dallas to see the fireworks. while getting ready before they began the show, we noticed two red lights a little off in the distance. i made a passing joke about ufo's, until we noticed they were progressively getting closer, proving they weren't fireworks because they were moving sideways and didn't explode. they were moving between 20-40 mph and were not that far above us. at one point they were directly above us. i looked away for a moment, and when i looked back they were completely vanished. i was able to take two photos on my cell phone that make them appear a little farther than they were, but they look exactly like so many other descriptions i have read from sighting all across the country.
content.summary: Two glowing red-orange orb-like hovering

content.detailedDescription: On 4th of july, a friend told me to come outside my home because he thought he sighted a a ufo. i went out side and watched this object in the sky that was pulsating a bright orange light. at first, i thought it was a satellite  it moved toward the west. i lost sight of the object when it went behind some clouds. i felt amazed to see such a sight.
content.summary: Saw object in sky with bright  pulsating orange light which moved to the west.

content.detailedDescription: I was walking with my girlfriend, a few blocks from my house to go watch some firewoks. once we had chosen a spot to stand and watch, the show had already begun. we were standing infront of three small trailer type venders selling ice cream and snacks. all three of the venders had elctricity, with lights and ice boxes, radios. we had been watching for approx. 10 min. when my girlfriend pointed out to be a redish orange orb object. the object seemed to glow and had no exterior lights. it did not glow with a brightness that hurt your eyes but yet still very bright. my first thought was that it was a peice of burning ash from the fireworks, but it came from my right side a good distance away from the fireworks when i first noticed it. after a min. the ball had moved and appeared to be heading on a path directly above the fire works. by this time i thought it was not ash because it had not burned out and had been moving a steady straight path. i did not see any lights so i thought it could not be a plane. after another min. the orb was just about out of my sight because of a tree line, all the power goes out in the venders stations behind me! the one stations lights flickered for an few seconds and i could here one of the venders say. does anyone know what just happend to the power. a min. later the lights came back on and the light in the sky was gone. when i noticed i could not see this object any more, i did notice a plane, which immediately reminded me that this is not what i just saw. the plane headed in the direction i origanally saw the object. this was a big gathering of people, there must have been 1500 people in the surrounding blocks, all outside looking up. my girlfriend and i could not have been the only two to see this, if u were watching the fireworks u could not miss it,  and i was very mad i did not have my phone on me to record all of this
content.summary: Bright redish orange ball traveling north at steady pace.

content.detailedDescription: In the eastern sky there appeared four glowing lights like jet exhausts but no noise and approaching not fading.  they just appeared. then faded after a couple of minutes.  watched through binoculars, no marker lights.
content.summary: Four lights appeared abrubtly, ascended slowly, disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: Me and my friend both saw it. we were on the grass behind the log cabin in the presidio watching fireworks. we were facing toward the bay bridge watching fireworks but noticed on our left what appeared to be a red orange orb, smallish, could have been a balloon but i noticed it didn't seem to be jumping in the strong westerly wind. and it glowed. and continued to glow as it first hovered in the direction of the fireworks and then floated, although with very very steady pathing to the east across the sf bay and continued until it went out of sight. we didn't hear chopper sounds. we didn't see blinking lights. just a constant glow and speed. nobody noticed but us as everyone was watching the fireworks. a bit later a helicopter came over toward the golden gate bridge and but it went back out toward the back and then south to see the fireworks too i assume. we think it was a bobbyist floating craft of some sort as it didn't "feel" like a ufo. but it was the weird how it didn't bounce around in the wind. so that's why i figured it worth reporting.
content.summary: Small red orb hovers towards fireworks and then out east

content.detailedDescription:
I was enjoying sparklers with the kids in my neighbors back yard. noticed a bright amber light to the south-west about 40 degrees above the horizon. caught my eye because of its size and relative brightness. it was as bright and as large as venus would be but amber colored. there were no other lights to indicate it was an airplane. it moved rapidly from west to east across the horizon. as it moved farther away to the east the cloud cover obscured the view. 

just as we lost interest and looked back to the west we noticed another one with the exact same properties. that is when i started recording. took a few moments to get the video recording started so it was south east by the time the video starts. they did not make a sound. in the beginning of the video i was walking down the slope of the yard and around a tree to get a better view as it moved away, so the jerky motion near the tree was just me moving around.

as the second object became obscured by the clouds we saw a third, again with the same properties and behavior.
content.summary: three bright amber objects traveling quickly from west to east

content.detailedDescription: July 5th 2012 around 10:15 pm. wife and i were outside watching stars in northern sky behind our house which is a cornfield. very low corn with complete open view of horizon and sky. we both noticed at the same time, a very bright red light appear in the sky about a mile or so out to the north west. the light hovered for several minutes before changing colors to a whiteish-yellow light. it proceeded to move left and right but hovered in its general area. i ran in the hose to grab my camcorder which unfortunately was not charged up. i ran back out in hopes of seeing the object ( my wife was still out watching it.) it was still in the air but appeared to be moving closer to us in a southward direction. several beams of light shot from it and at one point an object seemed to go into the object. the object appeared to change to a  "mechanical" look nd as it flew directly overhead our house we saw that it was a very large triangular craft with a light at each corner with one very bright white light in the center. another ting we noticed were several searchlights came on off the horizon from the north and the northwest. the object flew directly over our house and headed to the south. where we lost sight of it. a few minutes after the object passed, a dark double rotor helicopter with a searchlight flew in the area the object came from. the helicopter flew over the cornfield for a few minutes and then left the area. the searchlights also went off when the copter left the area. i've never seen these searchlights before. the object was appearantly to us very large we guess larger than a jumbojet.
content.summary: Saw bright red light in northern sky. very bright. hovered. then flew over my house. saw a triangluar craft.

content.detailedDescription: July 5th 2012 around 10:15 pm. wife and i were outside watching stars in northern sky behind our house which is a cornfield. very low corn with complete open view of horizon and sky. we both noticed at the same time, a very bright red light appear in the sky about a mile or so out to the north west. the light hovered for several minutes before changing colors to a whiteish-yellow light. it proceeded to move left and right but hovered in its general area. i ran in the hose to grab my camcorder which unfortunately was not charged up. i ran back out in hopes of seeing the object ( my wife was still out watching it.) it was still in the air but appeared to be moving closer to us in a southward direction. several beams of light shot from it and at one point an object seemed to go into the object. the object appeared to change to a  "mechanical" look nd as it flew directly overhead our house we saw that it was a very large triangular craft with a light at each corner with one very bright white light in the center. another ting we noticed were several searchlights came on off the horizon from the north and the northwest. the object flew directly over our house and headed to the south. where we lost sight of it. a few minutes after the object passed, a dark double rotor helicopter with a searchlight flew in the area the object came from. the helicopter flew over the cornfield for a few minutes and then left the area. the searchlights also went off when the copter left the area. i've never seen these searchlights before. the object was appearantly to us very large we guess larger than a jumbojet.
content.summary: Saw bright red light in northern sky. very bright. hovered. then flew over my house. saw a triangluar craft.

content.summary: Saw bright red light in northern sky. very bright. hovered. then flew over my house. saw a triangluar craft.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were returning  from a church event...I saw  the  lights  brighter  then fireworks and  almost stationary
5-6 amber spheres  crossed he road real  slow  not  descending  or mov ing  with  wind.. the gathered into a pentagon shape  then started  to sepereate   going east  and  west  till  they disapeared
..  we  watched  and  then  we  said drove  on..  staopped  the car  about   1/2  mile  later  and watched  till they  dissapereaed.. at first  i thought it was  fireworks ..  then  maybe balloons  with  lights  in  em.. but  they  wierd  slow synchronized movement.
content.summary: 5-6 amber spheres near linwood/ lawrence ks

content.detailedDescription: I had went outside at 10:15 p.M. to do my nightly rounds of checking on my livestock and make sure pens and cages were secure when i noticed the chickens making a lot of noise. i searched the area to make sure no raccoon or possum were around then headed back towards the house. i observed 4 white lights rotating clockwise then meeting in the center then spreading out and circling again. at first i thought it to be spotlights or something of that sort but then i realized where i was and that it is a thursday night with no grand events going on in or around town not to mention this place dies after jeopardy goes off. it has been really humid and hazy "we live very close to the kentucky river" with a lot of cloud cover so it was hard to get a good detailed look, and the fact that with all the haze and fog no source for the light could be spotted coming from the ground. i then went and got my wife to make sure i wasn't just imagining it and she as well saw what i saw. i tried to capture it on video with a camera and cell phone but was not very successful at getting anything other than a pitch black picture. the event lasted about 15 minutes then stopped. my wife then went inside and posted about it on facebook, low and behold a friend that lives on the other side or garrard county had witnessed it as well. she stated her sons told her to come outside and see the "aliens", she described exactly what we did with the same duration. still unsure about what it could have been.
content.summary: 4 lights circling above
